poem:
### Pillow Talk

Stitching dreams into cushions,  
he fluffs his kingdom of feathers,  
fortified in cotton cloud castles,  
where truth is stuffed and puffed,  
fingers pointing through threadbare seams.  
A trial, on the edge of waking,  
questions the patterns he's woven,  
as pillows whisper secrets  
only the night can hold.
